fields.description:
The FishEye DefaultUserManager depends on CrucibleFilter, which is only in the filter chain for Crucible installations, not standalone FishEye installations. This means when it tries to get the current user, there is no request stored in the CrucibleFilter thread local, and so illegal state exceptions are thrown.

See also https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/SAL-44
fields.summary: SAL's UserManager doesn't work without Crucible

fields.description:
In the JIRA Studio team, when we work on a review, we will read through the comments and often we will find one that requires us to go back and code some more. However, we do not want to drop the review right then and there, we would rather accumulate the changes that we need to make and only then go back to the code. The current workarounds within the team seem to be either having a pen and paper handy and write it down or use the 'Leave Unread' button to highlight the issue again. People turning to pen and paper is not great and using the 'Leave Unread' button confuses your workflow when new comments come in. Neither method is a real solution.

What I would really like to see is a way to turn a crucible comment into a 'TODO' item so that each person can generate their own todo list for each review. You could just tick each comment (similar to the way that you click 'Leave Unread') and that item becomes a todo item; which they can review later as one big list on a single page. I have attached an image of roughly what I meant.

Also, on the page that will contain the list of you todo item comments it would be nice if you could 'Mark as Done' at a specific revision as well (where you enter the revision in a text box or something similar).

But if you do not like that idea then I would merely request a nice way for us to mark items down for future work, development and attention. I think that would greatly improve the way that we move through our reviews.
fields.summary: Crucible Comments: Todo Items
Wiki Markup URLs are not rendered in Review E-mails

- Optionally use FE internal consistent date

fields.description:
In some circumstances, such as when a Review is still in the draft state, only allowing a delete action following an abandon action seems laborious.

Offering a delete option on the abandon dialogue, or even changing the Abandon Review button to a Cancel button in draft state and having it delete will be more inline with user expectations.

Similarly, the term abandon carries social weight not implied by the more casual "Trash". And trash has the added bonus of fitting snugly in to the Inbox paradigm.

We may still need an abandon or shelve option, but if we want to delete or trash a Review, let's be more upfront about it.
fields.summary: Raise "Delete" action to the same level as "Abandon", and implementing "Trash"

fields.description:
Currently navigating between unread comments is only possible via keyboard shortcuts ("[" and "]"). Assuming that relatively few people solely use shortcuts (I'd say they are for power users - experienced with Crucible), it means that standards users have no way to do it from UI.

Standards next/prev button navigate the user between all the comments (even if unread files are filtered out). Quite useless in iterative reviews.

I think that either the behaviour of this buttons should be modified (so that they work as [ and ]) or a new set of buttons should be added, or finally in the existing drop-down near this buttons we could have another option - "skip read reviews"

As an extension there must also be a way of filtering unread comments.
fields.summary: UI navigation/filtering unread comments

fields.description:
This is fail. Crucible already abuses e-mail notifications.
I usually perform reviews by creating always draft comments (e.g. if I further find something new, I can always adjust my previous comments without bothering other reviewers or the author).
Then I am posting all comments at one time. Today I realized that anyway I am still bombing other people's mailboxes.
fields.summary: While completing review, when Post All Drafts option is selected, Crucible should send ONE e-mail with all drafts rather than one e-mail per just posted draft comment

Expected results:

The dir tree should reflect the revision it links to
Files that don't exist at the revision being viewed should be greyed out

Actual results:

The dir tree displays the info of the newest revision 
Links to files that don't exist appear and 404

fields.description:
See:

                        <dd><rend:linkUserOrCommitter showAvatar="${true}" avatarSize="16" noHover="true"
                                             committer="${changeset.author}" repname="${this.repname}"/>
                        <dd><rend:linkToCommitter showAvatar="${true}" avatarSize="16" noHover="${true}"
                                             committerName="${changeset.author}" rep="${this.repname}"/>
                        <dd><rend:linkToUser showAvatar="${true}" avatarSize="16" noHover="${true}"
                                             userName="${changeset.author}"/></dd>
noHover should consitently take a string or Boolean, not allow either: linkUserOrCommitter doesn't accept expressions.
then we have:

rep/repname
committer/committerName
userName

I'd vote for repName/committerName/userName and a Boolean for noHover

fields.description:
To reproduce:
Navigate to the page that "List Entity Links" for one of the fisheye repositories and then click on the link on the left to "Configure Application Links" on the left.
Suddenly this page contains the js resource of the other page and an "internal server error" at the top of the page occurs, because it runs this js of the List Entity Links screen.

Web-resource for "List Entity Links screen":
http://cappuccino.sydney.atlassian.com:6060/foo/s/SNAPSHOT/1/3.0-SNAPSHOT/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.applinks.applinks-plugin:list-entity-links/com.atlassian.applinks.applinks-plugin:list-entity-links.js

Web-resoure for "Configure Application Links screen":
http://cappuccino.sydney.atlassian.com:6060/foo/s/SNAPSHOT/1/3.0-SNAPSHOT/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.applinks.applinks-plugin:list-application-links/com.atlassian.applinks.applinks-plugin:list-application-links.js

This scenario moving from Entity Link Screen to -> Application Link Screen results always in the wrong web-resource included in the page.

Intermittently the "List Application Link" web resources end up in the Entity Linking screen, causing the UI to fall apart.


It does look like a FishEye problem, but maybe the way we call the web-resource manager doesn't work with fisheye.
fields.summary: AppLinks plugin integration: Wrong web-resources included in page header.

fields.summary: Add some common navigation links to the bottom of long pages

fields.description:
When using JAXB in plugins a LinkageError occurs:
ava.lang.LinkageError: loader constraint violation: when resolving overridden method "com.sun.xml.bind.v2.runtime.unmarshaller.UnmarshallerImpl.unmarshal(Ljavax/xml/stream/XMLStreamReader;)Ljava/lang/Object;" the class loader (instance of org/apache/felix/framework/ModuleImpl$ModuleClassLoader) of the current class, com/sun/xml/bind/v2/runtime/unmarshaller/UnmarshallerImpl, and its superclass loader (instance of <bootloader>), have different Class objects for the type javax/xml/stream/XMLStreamReader used in the signature
    [java]     at com.atlassian.applinks.core.rest.client.ManifestRetriever.createRequestAndRetrieveManifest(ManifestRetriever.java:124)

I investigated this issue and my conclusion is:

This error happens only using Java 1.6 which ships with JAXB.
The plugins framework will enforce to export three JAXB packages (javax.xml.stream, javax.xml.stream.events javax.xml.stream.uti) from the host container as defined in jdk6-packages.txt.
This leads to a potential class loading error. When running java 1.6 classes of these packages are also exported to OSGI from the rest plugin.
I managed to fix this problem by:
# Modifying jdk6-packages.txt not to enforce the export of javax.xml.stream, javax.xml.stream.events javax.xml.stream.util, because they are provided by the rest plugin
# Modifying FisheyePackageScannerConfiguration which included by default "javax.xml.bind*","javax.*", to be exported to osgi.

Now only the rest plugin exports JAXB classes and the LinkageError disappeared.
fields.summary: Linkage error when using JAXB in plugins

fields.description:
This means:
* When an error comes in on email it should be:
*# Audited (is it a really error/warn)?
*#* If not, then the logging level should be reduced or the warning removed
*#* If it is, then depending on the complexity of the issue, it should be either fixed immediately or a JIRA should be raised
*#* If unsure, then the detail of the logging should be amended so that future occurrences are easily traceable

The goal is to make the email logs useful so that they easily alert the team as to when there is a problem in our instance
fields.summary: Resolve all eac/cru email logging errors

I'm unable to get my JIRA integration working properly and instead I see this:

{code}

09:42:28 WARN  - Exception encountered while retrieving activity items: 
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.atlassian.fisheye.activity.ActivityItemSearchParams.generateChangelogParams(ActivityItemSearchParams.java:259)
        at com.atlassian.crucible.activity.changeset.ChangesetCommentActivityItemProvider.getMoreActivityItems(ChangesetCommentActivityItemProvider.java:64)

fields.description:
as seen on eac cru http://skitch.com/gcrain/dx4dc/fisheye-and-crucible-administration

go to Repository List and the font is normal
click Application Links and the font goes small
click Repository List and the font stays small
refresh the page a few times and it goes back to normal
fields.summary: font size in admin pages seems to randomly change

fields.description:
A lot of Crucible work is *best* done with the keyboard.

But I can't *complete* a review with it.  There's no keyboard shortcuts for workflows given in the keyboard shortcut dialog.  Even if I  Quick Find to the Complete button in FireFox like I do for normal links I can't "click" on it with the Enter key. (Note: that technique works for the equivalent buttons in Confluence.)
fields.summary: Ability to complete/summarize review with keyboard

fields.description:
Complete a review which is not linked to a review.

!http://img.skitch.com/20100805-qqxre82rnerxr5ynhf9dn835m3.jpg!
fields.summary: JIRA hover shown for unlinked reviews

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Create a comment in crucible, and save it
# Edit the comment
# Add a new line to the line selection
# Observe that there is now a comment form *and* the old comment rendered in the page
# Saving the comment shows only the one comment, which is expected

Expected:
* There should only be a comment form visible
fields.summary: Changing lines of a comment creates a new comment form

fields.description:
To reproduce:

# Go to user profile
# Click 'Author Mapping'
# Add a mapping (or just use an existing explicit mapping)
# Click the edit link

Expected: Go to an edit page which allows you to select a different committer -- the dropdown should start with the currently mapped committer selected.

What happens: You go to the 'Add Mapping' page with the first committer in the repo selected in the drop down.

OT: the dropdowns should be converted to suggest boxes.
fields.summary: Clicking the edit link against an existing Author Mapping takes you to the Add mapping page, not an edit page

fields.description: Would like the initial set-up to accomplish everything necessary to begin using the product.  In this case, create the initial repo without needing to go into the Administrator.
fields.summary: Ability to define initial repository for indexing should be added to the set-up wizard

fields.description:
If a FE/CRU instance is using HSQLDB in production, then a banner should be displayed adjacent to the footer which says something like: {{This FishEye/Crucible instance is using HSQLDB, which is not supported in production environments}} and a link to some relevant CAC page.

If the instance is an evaluation server, then the message should say {{This FishEye/Crucible instance is using HSQLDB, which is only supported in evaluation environments}} and a link to the same CAC page.
fields.summary: When using HSQLDB, show a warning banner

fields.description: the "processCleanupNotifications" task is supposed to run every 12 hours. A misconfiguration of the Quartz cron job had it running every 12 minutes.
fields.summary: Clanger of a notification cleanup bug
Adding non-Crowd user to Crowd group results in 500

fields.description:
On a stock installation of Crucible (or Fisheye) the default "Admin" user cannot edit any OAuth settings.  When the Admin user clicks on the *Open Authentication (OAuth)* in the Administration screen they're presented with the login screen with a Username/Password.

As a workaround you can give a user Administration privileges and login with that user, which will allow OAuth configuration.
fields.summary: Cannot Configure OAuth with Crucible Admin User

fields.description:
there are several jar deps included several times unnecessarily, bloating the download size to over 100M. eg. fastutil is included twice (once by the core and once by the review coverage bundled plugin, at a cool 24M each time..

Scott complained that this was an impediment to evaluation
fields.summary: FishEye/Crucible distribution download size is unnecessarily large

fields.description:
Please refer to http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=45785&tstart=0


CR 2.3.5 with ClearCase 7.0.1 on RHEL5, when the designer tries to create a review from an activity, Crucible returns the error with log below:

==============================
Your request was unable to be processed
Javax.el.ELException

    * org.hibernate.exeception.DataException: could not execute JDBC batch update.
    * could not execute JDBC batch update
    * Data truncation: Data too long for column 'cru_revision' at low 1

==============================

In this clearcase activity, there are around 30 files with deep directory structure and quite long branch name.
fields.summary: CR 2.3.5: could not execute JDBC batch update
FishEye 404 pages should show suggestions

fields.description:
On pages such as changeset.jsp there's currently no mechanism to delay the placement of any JavaScripts to the close of the body. It can be delayed in an attribute, but this is rarely worthwhile.

Adding in a optional attribute will mean that JavaScript can be delayed till the DOM is in place without relying on external ready() functions.

It will improve ender time and will utilise the current load order better. To improve readability a Java comment can be added to the attributes which use the delayed position.
fields.summary: Add an attribute to pages using the threePanelPage that allows for the placement of a code block at the close of the body element

fields.description:
If you try to store a review title that is > 255 characters it is not saved and there is _no_ indication of failure in the UI. 

The logs dump something like:

{noformat}Caused by: java.sql.BatchUpdateException: Batch entry 0 update cru_review set cru_review_type='1', cru_name='0123456789012345.....6789', cru_default_source='BranchTest', cru_state='Review', cru_description='SAMPLE-1
TST-1

', cru_summary=NULL, cru_allow_reviewer_to_join='1', cru_create_date='1280381875156', cru_metrics_version='1', cru_all_reviewers_complete='1', cru_due_date='1280986675000', cru_issue_key='TST-1', cru_parent_review=NULL, cru_creator='2', cru_project='1' where cru_review_id='1' was aborted.  Call getNextException to see the cause.
        at org.postgresql.jdbc2.AbstractJdbc2Statement$BatchResultHandler.handleError(AbstractJdbc2Statement.java:2569)
        at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.processResults(QueryExecutorImpl.java:1796)
        at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.execute(QueryExecutorImpl.java:407)
        at org.postgresql.jdbc2.AbstractJdbc2Statement.executeBatch(AbstractJdbc2Statement.java:2708)
        at com.mchange.v2.c3p0.impl.NewProxyPreparedStatement.executeBatch(NewProxyPreparedStatement.java:1723)
        at org.hibernate.jdbc.BatchingBatcher.doExecuteBatch(BatchingBatcher.java:70){noformat}
fields.summary: Migrating from HSQLDB fails when constraints are violated

fields.description:
We rely on the database to enforce column lengths but we don't configure HSQL to enforce this. This means that customers often have to end up hacking the database to truncate columns that don't fit when migrating to an external database. 

Elsewhere (e.g. creating reviews from a changeset) I believe we truncate it before the 255 character limit. 

The upgrade task should print a list of issues that were truncated, and perhaps prepend the original title to the description to alert the administrator.
fields.summary: Validate field lengths in the UI where they have a limit.

fields.description:
Getting data for : http://lech:5223/crucible/rest-service/search-v1/reviewsForIssue/?jiraKey=PL-1&maxReturn=10
doesn't return review even if in one issue (CR-14) issue is hyperlinked in Crucible WEB UI.

How to reproduce:
1. Crucible administration
  a) add JIRA server
  b) add proper mappings for this server 
2. Create review in Crucible and Issue in JIRA
3. Add issue key in crucible general comment

Issue key is click able but  review is not available via Rest API:rest-service/search-v1/reviewsForIssue/?jiraKey=ISSUE_KEY&maxReturn=SOME_INT
fields.summary: Getting reviews for a JIRA issue does not returns proper review list

fields.description:
Crucible only supports MySQL & PostgreSQL database servers if we wish to use something other than the easily corrupted hsqldb.  Neither MySQL or PostgreSQL are platforms available at my company, which is quite typical of the banking world.  Usually only Oracle, SqlServer and Sybase are available.

Bamboo and Jira support Sql Server and so Crucible should too, to be consistent.
fields.summary: Crucible should support MS SqlServer

fields.description:
To replicate add a link such as: {{\[Google\|http://www.google.com\]}} 

!http://img.skitch.com/20100802-j9xt1ck55eufa9hft3nh15kiye.jpg!
fields.summary: Links are broken in wiki renderer - Unable to render content due to system error: sourceName must not be null

fields.description: The only way one can see a review's due date as a date is by going to the "edit details" page (which, of course, can only be done with certain permissions).  Instead, we display "Due in 3 days" or whatnot.  We need to show an actual date somewhere, unambiguously "Due August 21, 2010"
fields.summary: Need some display of a review due date on review detail page

fields.description: Per the UX Review on August 2, 2010
fields.summary: Design branch and tag filter for the FE directory tree

fields.description:
This happens when a user doesn't have permission to create reviews in any projects. 

We don't let users without permission to create reviews in any projects have access to the various create review links. It should be the same for snippets.
fields.summary: Users who can't create snippets can still see the create snippet links.

fields.description:
Feature request to resize the side by side diff as follows: 

!http://img.skitch.com/20100802-j9q5fgdqgug45wwa1hjyisx878.jpg!
fields.summary: Resize splitter in side by side diff

fields.description:
Currently, the command line output when first installing an eval is as follows:

Tim-Buntels-MacBook-Pro:bin tbuntel$ ./run.sh
10:45:02 INFO  - FishEye/Crucible 2.3.4 (20100712032131), Built on 2010-07-12
10:45:02 INFO  - 
10:45:02 INFO  - =======================================================
10:45:02 INFO  - 
10:45:02 INFO  - Welcome to Crucible!
10:45:02 INFO  - 
10:45:02 INFO  - You need to configure an admin password and enter your
10:45:02 INFO  - license key. You can do this by accessing FishEye through
10:45:02 INFO  - a web browser, once the server has started:
10:45:02 INFO  - 
10:45:02 INFO  - http://hostaddress:8060/
10:45:02 INFO  - 
10:45:02 INFO  - Refer to the Crucible administration guide
10:45:02 INFO  - for more information:
10:45:02 INFO  - 
10:45:02 INFO  - http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Crucible+101
10:45:02 INFO  - 
10:45:02 INFO  - =======================================================
10:45:02 INFO  - 
Could not find a FishEye or Crucible license.
 Please visit http://my.atlassian.com to retrieve an existing license, 
     quote BC7L-EZUQ-PL68-0GT5 to obtain a new license,
     or visit http://www.atlassian.com/fisheye/renew to renew your license.
10:45:03 WARN  - No license info available, not updating Crucible user count.
10:45:03 INFO  - Periodic polling for software updates is disabled.
10:45:11 INFO  - Starting plugin system...
10:45:15 INFO  - Starting database...
10:47:04 INFO  - Server started on :8060 (http) (control port on 127.0.0.1:8059)
10:47:04 WARN  - No license info available, not starting FishEye repositories.

UGH!!!  That's not a very friendly welcome!  It makes it seem that things aren't working properly.

We need to change these messages, both text and sequence, to direct users to the new HTML setup process.

1. Check for license, display "Could not find a FishEye or Crucible license." if none found
2. Output "Setting up evaluation version"
3. Output INFO message on services starting (database, server, etc.)
4. And finally display the big welcome block only when the server is actually running

=======================================================
Welcome to Crucible!

You need to complete the product installation through a web browser. 
Please access the set-up page at:
 
http://127.0.0.1:8060/

Refer to the Crucible administration guide
for more information:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Crucible+101
=======================================================
fields.summary: Command line messages on first install startup need to be improved

fields.description:
If you remove the "default" Permission Scheme from a stock Crucible installation, you're unable to create any new projects.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Install a fresh copy of Crucible.
2. Delete the "default" Permission Scheme.
3. Try to create a new Project.

Stack trace:

{noformat}
2010-07-30 17:03:13,645 ERROR [btpool0-2] fisheye.console com.cenqua.crucible.model.managers.PermissionManager-getDefaultPermissionScheme - No default permission scheme exists
2010-07-30 17:03:13,649 ERROR [btpool0-2] org.mortbay.log org.mortbay.log.Slf4jLog-warn - /crucible/admin/newProject.do
Unable to instantiate Action, com.cenqua.crucible.actions.admin.project.NewProjectAction, defined for
'newProject' in namespace '/admin'Error creating bean with name 'com.cenqua.crucible.actions.admin.project.NewProjectAction': Instantiation of
bean failed; nested exception is org.springframework.beans.BeanInstantiationException: Could not instantiate bean class [com.cenqua.crucible.actions.admin.project.NewProjectAction]:
Constructor threw exception; nested exception is java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.createAction(DefaultActionInvocation.java:243)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.init(DefaultActionInvocation.java:322)
{noformat}

Attached is the full stack trace.
fields.summary: Deleting "default" Permission Scheme Breaks New Project Creation
